Sentencas: Mixtures of 3% yttria- and partially-stabilized zirconia with LSMx (strontium-doped lanthanum manganite, x=0, 0.15 and 0.2) were prepared and heat treated at temperatures between 1000 and 1300 degrees C to recreate the cathode-electrolyte interface interactions taking place during preparation and operation of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Determination of strontium and lanthanum zirconates in YPSZ-LSM mixtures for SOFC

Sentencas: Such interactions include the formation of La2Zr2O7 and SrZrO3, which are undesirable for SOFC.
Titulo: Determination of strontium and lanthanum zirconates in YPSZ-LSM mixtures for SOFC

Sentencas: The effect of the manganese oxidation number on the mechanosynthesis of LSM during zirconate formation is also discussed.
Titulo: Determination of strontium and lanthanum zirconates in YPSZ-LSM mixtures for SOFC

Sentencas: A quantitative analysis of zirconate formation by X-ray diffraction and Rietveld refinement was undertaken.
Titulo: Determination of strontium and lanthanum zirconates in YPSZ-LSM mixtures for SOFC

Sentencas: Formation of lanthanum and strontium zirconates was completely avoided at temperatures as high as 1300 degrees C by synthesizing lanthanum marganites from MnO2 doped with 15 at.% of Sr.
Titulo: Determination of strontium and lanthanum zirconates in YPSZ-LSM mixtures for SOFC

Sentencas: Finally, in the presence of LSM, monoclinic phase content was diminished to less than 1.5 mol% after heat treatment at 1300 degrees C. (C) 2008
Titulo: Determination of strontium and lanthanum zirconates in YPSZ-LSM mixtures for SOFC
